Physics (Waves & Communication).subject: Physics (Waves & Communication)
Physics (Waves & Communication).question: Television signal cannot be received generally beyond a particular distance due to
Physics (Waves & Communication).explanation: Curvature of the earth does not allow the television signals to be received beyond a particular distance.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: If a small raindrop falls through air
options: its velocity goes on increasing for sometime and then becomes constant
it falls with constant speed for sometime and then its velocity increases
Physics (Mechanics).answer: its velocity goes on increasing for sometime and then becomes constant
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Velocity of raindrop increases until it reaches the terminal velocity.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question:
Consider the following satements
X-rays
1. can pass through aluminum.
2. can be deflected by magnetic field.
3. move with a velocity less than the velocity of ultraviolet ray in vacuum.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: X-rays cannot be deflected by magnetic field as they consists of no charge. X-rays and UV rays are electromagnetic wave, so they move with same velocity in vacuum i.e. 3 × 108 m/s.

Physics (Waves & Sound).subject: Physics (Waves & Sound)
Physics (Waves & Sound).question: Which one of the following is the permissible level of noise in a silent zone at day time?

Physics (Electromagnetism).subject: Physics (Electromagnetism)
Physics (Electromagnetism).question: By which one of the following, an old written material which cannot be read easily, can be read
Physics (Electromagnetism).explanation: Infrared rays helps in reading an old written material.

Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry)
Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry).question: Which one of the following is heavy water used in nuclear reactor?
options: Water at 4°C but having molecular weight 19 u
Water below the ice in a frozen sea
Chemistry (Nuclear Chemistry).explanation: Heavy water (D2O) is used in nuclear reactor as a moderator. The deuterium is an isotope of hydrogen. Its atomic mass is 2. Hence its molecular weight is 20u (2 + 18).

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: The rusting of iron nail
options: does not affect weight but iron is oxidised
does not affect weight but iron is reduced
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation:
The rusting of iron nail takes place in the presence of air (oxygen) and water (moisture). It increases the weight of iron nail due to the formation of rust.
4Fe + 3O2 + xH2O ® 2Fe2O3.xH2O
Rust

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: Which one of the following when dissolved in H2O gives hissing sound?
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation:
On adding water, quicklime (CaO) gives a hissing sound and forms calcium hydroxide commonly known as slaked lime.
CaO + H2O ® C Ca (OH)2 + 15000 calories

Chemistry (Polymers).subject: Chemistry (Polymers)
Chemistry (Polymers).question: Commercial vulcanisation of rubber involves
Chemistry (Polymers).explanation: Vulcanisation is a process in which natural rubber is treated with 3-5% sulphur. It introduces sulphur bridges between polymer chains thereby increasing its tensile strength, elasticity and resistance to abrasion.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Aqua-regia used by alchemists to separate silver and gold is a mixture of
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Aqua-regia is a mixture of concentrated nitric acid and concentrated hydrochloric acid in the ratio 1 : 3 respectively. It is a very powerful oxidising mixture.

Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Organic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).question: Nail polish remover contains
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).explanation: Acetone is used as a solvent. It is an ingredient of nail polish remover.

Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Organic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).question: Which one of the following petroleum refinery products has the lowest boiling point?
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).explanation:
Product Boiling Point (°C)
(a) Kerosene 200-300°
(b) Diesel above 300°
(c) Gasoline 25-75°C
(d) Lubricating oil >350°C

Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Applied Chemistry)
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).question:
Statement I : Soaps do not form lather with water containing salts of calcium and magnesium.
Statement II : Calcium and magnesium salts of long chain fatty acids are insoluble in water.
options: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Both the statements are individually true but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I.
Statement I is true, but Statement II is false.
Statement I is false, but Statement II is true.
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).answer: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).explanation: Soaps do not form lather with hard water which contains salts of calcium and magnesium because calcium and magnesium salts of long chain fatty acids are insoluble in water.

Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry)
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).question: Which one of the following is associated with the formation of brown air in traffic congested cities?
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).explanation: Nitrogen dioxide (NO2) is a reddish brown gas. It has pungent smell and considered as air pollutant. In the presence of sunlight hydrocarbons and oxides of Nitrogen react to form ozone and PAN (peroxy Acetyl Nitrate). Smog is formed in traffic congested cities. Hytrocarbon + Nitrogen oxides —Sunlight—> O3 + PAN+aldehyde

Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry)
Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).question: Which one of the following is used as a mordant in dyeing and tanning industry?
Chemistry (Industrial Chemistry).explanation: Magnesium sulphate (MgSO4) is used as a mordant in dyeing and tanning industry.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: In human beings, the opening of the stomach into the small intestine is called
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: The stomach shows division into two parts fundic and pyloric region. The pyloric region enters small intestine through pyloric valve of pylorus.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: Which one of the following is an example of vestigial organ in man?
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: The ear muscles are vestigial organs in man. Vestigial organs are not functional in organisms. These are not active in related animals but were functional in their ancestors. There are more than 90 vestigial organs in human beings.

Biology (Nutrition).subject: Biology (Nutrition)
Biology (Nutrition).question:
Match the following
List-I (Vitamin)
A. Vitamin-A
B. Vitamin-B1
C. Vitamin-C
D. Vitamin-E
List-II (Chemical Compound)
1. Thiamine
2. Retinol
3. Ascorbic acid
4. Tocopherol
Codes:

Biology (Human Health).subject: Biology (Human Health)
Biology (Human Health).question: Which one of the following is considered as the drug of last resort for human beings?
Biology (Human Health).explanation: Chloramphenicol affects bacteria which are resistant to all other medicine. Chloramphenicol is a prototypical broad spectrum bacteria killing drug.

Biology (General Biology).subject: Biology (General Biology)
Biology (General Biology).question:
Match the following
List-I (Medicinal Product)
A. Quinine
B. Morphine
C. Penicillin
D. Tetracycline
List-II (Source)
1. Poppy plant
2. Bacterium
3. Cinchona bark
4. Fungus
Codes:
Biology (General Biology).explanation: Cinchona bark creates quinine which is an anti-malarial drug. Poppy plant creates morphine it is an opium alkaloid, which is a strong analgesic and also has sedative and soothing effect. Fungus and bacterium are the sources of antibiotics penicillin and tetracycline respectively.

Biology (Botany).subject: Biology (Botany)
Biology (Botany).question: Wavelengths of which of the following colour of the visible spectrum of light are maximally absorbed by green plants?
Biology (Botany).explanation: Green plants absorb red and blue colour maximally.

Biology (Botany).subject: Biology (Botany)
Biology (Botany).question: Which one of the following plants is preferred for mixed cropping in order to enhance the bioavailability of nitrogen?
Biology (Botany).explanation: The root nodules of gram plant contain symbiotic bacteria which is responsible for fixing nitrogen. So, gram is preferred for mixed farming.

Biology (Botany).subject: Biology (Botany)
Biology (Botany).question: Bryophytes are photosynthetic but do not have vascular tissue and true roots. This feature enables them to resemble with which of the following?
Biology (Botany).explanation: Bryophytes do not have vascular bundles (xylem & phloem) and roots so they show similarity with algae.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: The plant dye Henna imparts orange-red colour to skin and hairs due to its reaction with which of the following?
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Henna (Lawsonia inermis) is a flowering plant. It is used to dye skin, hair, fingernails, leather and wood. Colouring feature of henna is due to lawsone, an organic compound that shows affinity for proteins and amino acids in animals.

Biology (Biotechnology).subject: Biology (Biotechnology)
Biology (Biotechnology).question: The genetically engineered 'Golden Rice' is rich in which of the following?
Biology (Biotechnology).explanation: Golden rice is rich in b-carotene and iron. It is a variety of Oryza sativa evolved through process of bio technology to synthesize b -carotene, a precursor of pro-vitamin -A.

Biology (Microbiology).subject: Biology (Microbiology)
Biology (Microbiology).question: Which one of the following is a freeliving bacterium that helps in nitrogen fixation in soil?
Biology (Microbiology).explanation: Azotobacter is a genus of usually motile and free living bacteria that builds thick walled cysts. They are able to fix nitrogen in soil.

Biology (Zoology).subject: Biology (Zoology)
Biology (Zoology).question: Which one of the following characteristics is common among parrot, platypus and kangaroo?
Biology (Zoology).explanation: The parrot, platypus and kangaroo fall in the group of warm blooded animals. They show homothermy.
